abstract: Norway's King Harald V served as a symbol of patriotism after July 2011 bombing and shooting spree by homegrown terrorist Anders Behring Breivik; tragic events were test of Harald's leadership, and he is considered to have passed it.
snippet: July 22, when 77 people were killed by a homegrown terrorist in Norway, was King Harald V’s test. He is considered to have passed it.
lead_paragraph: July 22, when 77 people were killed by a homegrown terrorist in Norway, was King Harald V’s test. He is considered to have passed it.

headline.main: Again in Norway, Events Provide Test for a King’s Mettle
headline.print_headline: Again in Norway, Events Provide Test for a King’s Mettle
headline.seo: King Harald of Norway Proves Mettle With Response to July 22 Deaths
